creator: analogue@yahoo.com
text:
It would be nice if the output of each test case, regardless of whether it 
passed or not, is available for viewing in the HTML generated by the 
JUNitReport task. The output is avaiable via the <system-out> and <system-err> 
tags included in each of the generated XML files.

creator: jakarta@ehatchersolutions.com
text:
The <report> sub-element allows for the use of custom XSL, so you could tweak 
the XSL provided and add that in. I just wanted to make you aware, if you 
weren't already, that its not hardcoded and is user extensible.

creator: sbailliez@apache.org
text:
The default xsl is just an example of what can be done to show the result in a 
somewhat pleasant experience. As Erik said you can customize it to suit your 
needs as I believe that output is useless for all people I have seen using 
JUnit as of now.

So if you have absolutely need the output I recommend you to customize your 
xsl.
